page.title: 05Housing(Survey)
page.content: The majority of people owned their own home - only 14% lived in rented or council accomodation. The most popular type of housing was semi-detached, as this usually meant that the houses had spacious gardens. The number of people living in detached houses and bungalows was slightly less but there were even fewer people living in terraced houses and flats as these were smaller and had very little space for the room required by a family. {Heating:}31 of the 36 people questioned had central heating in their home; 68% had gas powered heating whilst the other 32% powered their homes using electric, oil, solid-fuel or a combination of fuels.
